fi.grimripper.loww.tiles

Class Obstacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.tiles.Obstacle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdditionalProperties
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MobileObject

    public abstract class Obstacle
extends java.lang.Object
implements AdditionalProperties
    Obstacles are items that can be placed on a tile grid. Examples include puddles and rocks, but also mobile objects like armies, and large immobile objects such as cities. An obstacle can be something that simply exists on the tile grid, or it can affect the movement of mobile objects, among other things. An obstacle by default is limited in what kind of effect it can have, but additional functionality can be implemented through movement events, for example. Mobile objects are also obstacles, with additional properties for movement.

    Each obstacle resides in a tile, although there are also large obstacles which can spread into multiple tiles. An obstacle has a template which determines what tiles the obstacle covers, using the obstacle's location and the direction it faces.

    Obstacles can prevent moving objects from moving across them, and also alter movement costs in other ways. They also influence movement height. Depending on an obstacle's height, a mobile object can move over it and not be affected by it. Some obstacles cause mobile objects to move on top of them. An obstacle can occupy a tile so that no other occupying obstacles can be placed in the same tile. A larger obstacle occupies all tiles in its template.

    Author:
    Marko Tuominen
    See Also:
    MovementEvent, ObstacleTemplate, Tile

      • getHeight

        public Height getHeight()
        Gets the obstacle's height.
        Returns:
        the obstacle's height

      • getTotalHeight

        public Height getTotalHeight()
        Gets the combination of occupy height and obstacle's own height. This is basically the sum of the two, but limited between the obstacle's own height and very high. A low obstacle will be low even if it's occupy height is less than flat, for example, while a low obstacle on top of a very high obstacle will be very high rather than blocking. A blocking obstacle will be blocking regardless of occupy height.
        Returns:
        obstacle's height combined with occupy height (null if the obstacle hasn't been placed on the tile grid)
        See Also:
        getHeight(), getOccupyHeight()

      • getOccupyHeight

        public Height getOccupyHeight()
        Gets the height where the obstacle is located.
        Returns:
        current occupy height

      • setOccupyHeight

        public void setOccupyHeight(Height occupyHeight)
        Sets the height where the obstacle is currently located. Occupy height depends on terrain, and it's also possible for an obstacle to be placed on top of another. Occupy height is not set automatically.
        Parameters:
        occupyHeight - current occupy height

      • getLocation

        public Tile getLocation()
        Gets the obstacle's location, or main tile.
        Returns:
        the tile where the obstacle resides (or main tile for large obstacles)

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(Tile location)
        Sets the obstacle's location. The obstacle removes itself from its previous location, if applicable, then adds itself to its new location. Removing and adding apply to all tiles defined by the obstacle's template, using current facing. The update isn't done if the obstacle doesn't have a facing. The obstacle can't be placed partially outside the tile grid, but it can be removed completely by setting location as null. The obstacle's occupy height in the new location is by default set as terrain height. Highest terrain in the new template determines occupy height.
        Parameters:
        location - set the obstacle's location (main tile for its template)

      • getFacing

        public Direction getFacing()
        Gets the direction this obstacle is facing.
        Returns:
        the direction this obstacle is facing

      • getTemplateFacing

        public Direction getTemplateFacing()
        Gets the direction which determines template's position relative to obstacle location.
        Returns:
        template's facing direction

      • setFacing

        public void setFacing(Direction facing)
        Sets the obstacle's facing. Facing affects the obstacle's template, but otherwise it has no effect at all. Because template requires facing, the obstacle isn't added to the tile grid with only location, but needs facing as well. If facing changes, the obstacle will turn in place. The obstacle's facing and that of its template are separate, because some directions aren't suitable for determining template tiles.
        Parameters:
        facing - set the obstacle to face this direction
        See Also:
        Templates.getTemplateDirection(Direction, ObstacleTemplate)

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Direction facing,
               Tile location)
        Sets facing and location at the same time. The obstacle will be removed from its current tiles (if any), then added to the new tiles. In some situations, changing location without changing facing can cause the obstacle's template to be partially outside the tile grid, which is likely to cause problems.
        Parameters:
        facing - new facing
        location - new location

      • getTemplate

        public ObstacleTemplate getTemplate()
        Gets the tile template depicting the obstacle's size and shape.
        Returns:
        the obstacle's tile template

      • preventsMovement

        public final boolean preventsMovement(int impassable)
        Check if this obstacle prevents normal movement and occupation. Actually tries to modify a 1.0 movement cost and checks if the result is higher than maximum movement. This test doesn't have anything to do with this obstacle occupying a tile.
        Parameters:
        impassable - the movement cost considered impassable
        Returns:
        true if this obstacle prevents moving through the tile and occupying it

      • modifyMoveCost

        public float modifyMoveCost(float cost,
                   int impassable)
        Modifies a mobile object's movement cost. By default, an obstacle prevents movement and this method returns a value that indicates impassability. Subclasses can have varying effects on movement costs.
        Parameters:
        cost - movement cost without the effects of this obstacle
        impassable - the amount of movement considered impassable
        Returns:
        movement cost with the effects of this obstacle

      • modifyMoveHeight

        public Height modifyMoveHeight(Height height)
        Modifies a mobile object's movement- and occupy height. By default, an obstacle doesn't have an effect on movement- or occupy height and this method returns the height unchanged.
        Parameters:
        height - height without the effects of this obstacle
        Returns:
        height with the effects of this obstacle

      • occupiesTile

        public boolean occupiesTile()
        Checks if this obstacle occupies the tiles where it resides. A tile can't contain two occupying obstacles. Mobile objects can only end their moves in a tile which they can occupy, including other nearby tiles for template. By default obstacles occupy tiles, so this method returns true.
        Returns:
        this obstacle occupies tiles where it's placed

      • blocksLineOfSight

        public boolean blocksLineOfSight(Obstacle obstacle)
        Checks if this obstacle blocks the line of sight for another obstacle. Obstacles can be biased in which obstacles can "see" through them. By default obstacles block line of sight so this method returns true.
        Parameters:
        obstacle - check if line of sight is blocked for this obstacle
        Returns:
        the line of sight is blocked

      • setHeight

        protected void setHeight(Height height)
        Sets the obstacle's height.
        Parameters:
        height - set the obstacle's height

      • setTemplate

        protected void setTemplate(ObstacleTemplate t)
        Sets the obstacle's template. Ignores null parameters. If the obstacle has a location and a facing, changing its template will cause an update to the tiles where it resides. When something changes an object's template, it should also ensure the new template fits current location and facing.
        Parameters:
        t - the obstacle's new template
